boardgame.name: Port Royal
Πορτ Ρουαγιάλ
Порт Роял
Порт-Ройал
ポートロイヤル
皇家港
boardgame.description: The merchant players in Port Royal, which won the Austrian Game Designers Competition under the title H_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;ndler der Karibik, are trying to earn as much as they can out of the Caribbean Sea, but if they set their goals too high, they might take home nothing for the day._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The 120-card deck depicts a coin on the back of each card _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; with players earning and paying coins throughout the game _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; and different items on the card fronts. On a turn, a player can first draw as many cards as he likes, one at a time from the deck, placing them in the harbor (an area near the deck). Each card shows one of the following:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Person, who stays in a face-up row next to deck._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Ship, which the player can attack immediately if he has enough swords on his people cards, after which the ship is discarded; otherwise, the ship stays in the harbor._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Expedition, which remains above the harbor until a player fulfills it by discarding people who have the items required for the expedition._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Tax Increase, which forces everyone with twelve or more coins to discard half their money, after which the card is discarded._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;If the player draws a ship with the same name as a ship already in the harbor, he's spent too much time dilly-dallying and his turn ends (after using the ship to attack, if possible), with all the cards in the harbor being discarded. Otherwise, the player can stop whenever he likes, then use/acquire one card if three or fewer ships are in the harbor, two cards if four ships are present, and three cards if five ships are present. Players rob ships, collecting the number of coins shown on them, then discarding the card, while they hire people, paying the number of coins depicted. After the active player takes his 1-3 cards, each other player may pay the active player one coin in order to take one card in the same way._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;When one player has at least twelve influence points _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; which are on both people and expedition cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash; the game is played to the end of the round, giving everyone the same number of turns, then the player with the most influence points wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;bull; Port Royal differs from H_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;ndler der Karibik in that it includes ten more cards to allow for play with up to five players and players can win without fulfilling an expedition._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

A quick-playing card game with a push-your-luck element and a piratical theme. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s good fun packed into little more than a deck of cards. The price shown is for UK/EU purchasers (and includes VAT). For purchasers outside the EU, the price is £6.67 (net of UK tax - note that the purchaser is responsible for paying any duty or tax due on import to their country). I charge shipping at cost and I can offer several options (or ask me to get a quote from couriers). To UK addresses: myHermes (2-3 working days, tracked) £2.98 Second class post (2-3 working days) £3.36 First class post (1 working day) £3.84 To other EU countries: Air mail (1 week or so) £9.66 Outside the EU: Air mail in Europe (1 week or so) £8.05 Air mail (about 1 week, no tracking) £13.60 (Australasia)/£12.85 (elsewhere) Surface mail (up to 8 weeks, no tracking) £8.00

Played once. Item is in very good condition. I treat my games very well. If there are components inside the game they are most likely bagged in 4mm, thick bags. I ship via USPS, which is most cost effective. When I ship things I take extra measurers to mitigate any potential shipping damage. Shipping from 98012. Here’s some shipping ESTIMATES to help you get an idea of what it will cost. Your distance from my Zip Code (98012) and box weight are the biggest factors in price.
